The sudden speed causes a small silver love heart, hangin a silver chain necklace from the rearview mirror, to cras against the window. The catch bursts open to reveal two t photos of the twins inside. The necklace flies back and f against the window as the Explorer races onwards. 50

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plymouth accelerates behind blasting rap. Its thick t plow along the wet asphalt, gripping to the road below in steady pursuit. Its windows are all steamed up. The front passenger window is open, a hand and a gun muzzle stick through. Scene 51Page 36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another flash and Della's left side mirror shatters. She swerves in panic. Her car almost hits the ditch. This can't be happening. Not to her. She reclaims the steering wheel.   Straightens up. Hits t accelerator again. 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plymouth swerves behind on the skid that Della create corrects itself just before the ditch. Della gains speed. The Plymouth lags. A stop sign appears ahead. The road's ending. 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right or left, Della? Make a choice. 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no choice. A barrier blocks the left hand turn. big sign reads "LOT FULL". 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della swings right instead. The streetlights recede behind her. 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but the darkness of a housing complex under construction ahead. But she seems to have shaken off her pursuers. She speeds down the road, looking intently for any sign o life. But there's nothing but half-built houses, empty houses, houses just like hers. 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Seven Eleven sign appears. She slows down. But it may a well be a mirage, it's an unfinished building with only t sign, in an unfinished mini-mall. Scene 58Page 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close to screaming now she speeds up. 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More empty houses in varying stages of construction. No s of life. 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, what looks like a filling station, one light on in kiosk. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope. She pulls in and dims her lights, drives right up t the kiosk door. Hope dashed. 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in its final stages of installation but definitely n functioning. And there's no one there. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back onto the road and she sees far behind her, car headlights that can only belong to the Plymouth, followin her through the darkness. She dims her lights to just the side lights. Hurtles alon the dark road which is getting rougher and rougher. Potho filled with mud and rain water splash against the car. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her wipers struggle to cope. She can hardly see through t front window. 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The potholes yawn deeper. The asphalt ends. Gravel deteriorates to dirt. 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steers the Ford blindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wooden barrier with reflective stripes looms suddenly ahead. 68

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She guns the engine and ducks sideways as her car PLOWS i the barrier. There's a sickening crack as shattered windshield sprays around her. 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Explorer SLAMS through and VEERS towards a clump of trees. 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della tries to sit upright but the auto's spinning too fa 71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car swings, then CRASHES right into a Pine tree. 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Car stalls out. SILENCE. A prolonged moment. Then Della crawls out from under the dashboard, sweeping needles and glass from her hair. She reaches up and hits light switch. Pine branches protrude through the broken windshield. Using the sleeve of her coat she sweeps broken glass from driver's seat and sits down. She slides the gear into park, turns the key. The engine groans like a dying animal, then gives up. She takes a deep breath. She tries again. The engine groans again, another death rattle. It just won't catch. She switches off the interior light and pushes the driver door open. She steps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door behind her so's not to trigger the li switch. Finds her legs are giddy. Holds onto the door fra for a moment to steady herself. It looks like she's crashed at the very end of the housin development - where it cuts like a knife edge into an old forest. The dirt road stretches ahead beyond the barrier, into th midst of the forest. Behind her, shrouded in darkness, ho in different stages of development dot the deforested landscape. Land moving trucks sit on recently flattened land, waiting to tear into the next layer of forest. Patches of leftover snow and puddles of rain catch the li from the moon which hides in an overcast sky. Jesus! She's driven all the way from the Mall only to fin herself in the middle of nowhere with a bunch of psychopa on her tail. This must be some sick joke. Speaking of which, where are these little bastards? Her e scan the darkness for a sign. Nothing. That doesn't mean they're not close by. She checks out the damage to the car by feel. The driver' side is scratched and dented. The front is wedged into th tree. The only way out is for her to back up the car. She climbs back in for another try. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della turns the key. It barely even groans this time. Jus faint gurgle. Then gone. She rifles in the glove compartment and pulls out the fla sticks it in her pocket. She leans under the dash and manually pops the trunk. 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della runs outside to the back of the car and feels about the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws carrier bags full of wrapping paper to the sid she searches. Pulls out a lug wrench from underneath and a small tool box. She hears the screech of a car's wheels spinning in mud. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della turns to see headlights in the distance on the road behind, pointing upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh! The Plymouth must have skidded and got stuck in the mud. 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the trunk softly then runs to the front of the car, clutching the toolbox and the wrench. She reaches ba into the car and unlatches the hood from underneath the d Pop. She softly closes the door again. Punches her way through the branches. Slides her fingers under the hood, pries up the lever. It pops up only a few inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! She tries to manually lift it. But it's heavy with the we of pine branches. Voices drift towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep hitting on the gas and you gonna dig them wheels into a dirt grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save yo talk and get out and push. The sound of car doors opening, feet squishing into the m and cussing. The boys materialize in the light from the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's aggravating you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our new sneakers are stuck up in the dirt like they was last years. Doors slam and two sets of footsteps join the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as we taken care o' Mrs. Podunk you and the Spanish dancer can hit the next mall. But first you fakers best haul this rider out of the filth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid ass car got nowhere else to go. There's nothing but trees up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw the car, Chuckie. Case you forgot we got a witness on the loose! I ain't want to end up in the clink as some chimp's prison pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me dog, hoe's going down execution style before we see the other side o' them bars. Della drops the hood. It makes a faint squeak but doesn't slam down, seems it's stuck open these last few inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo talk a real mob threat, Chuckie. But what if she gone already? Chuckie's eyes scan the housing estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't gone. Della frantically sweeps pine branches and cones from the hood. But some larger branches are jammed, wedged by the broken tree. When she looks back over for the boys she sees the car headlights are off and there's no sign of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands stock still, listening, scanning the landscape a sign of them. The sound of glass shattering breaks the silence. Della jumps out of her skin, spins around. Her eyes settl a light in the distance. 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light illuminates the small cabin of an earth moving truck. The cabin glows like a box in the darkness. There' figure inside: it's Chuckie. He's inspecting a powerful construction flashlight. He switches settings from broad light to concentrated beam. He points the beam through th broken glass window onto Tomas, who's standing on a truck tyre knocking out the rest of the glass with his elbow. Chuckie leaps down through the broken window, pleased wit his find. He switches it to broad beam, whistles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be long before we find her now. This baby could spot a needle in a haystack! The light dances around illuminating each of their faces seconds at a time. Eerie distorted glimpses. They're traipsing along the rough road, through the mud, towards Della. Their voices grow louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We caught up in this bitch's life like a soap opera. We could just bail, blast out of town like we was never here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy loves weed so much he tried to marry Juana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no one cares about the Rent-a- Pig. He just collateral damage to the peeps at the mall. Chuckie pushes Huey half playfully, half annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up skippy: SHE THE ONLY WITNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if we hit the road now we'll be five hundred miles away before they find him....we could be drinking cold beer and swimmin' in the Atlantic....just like you promised. Huey stares off into space like he's having a vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta take care of her. When she gone. The problem gone. Right? We'll head off then, Huey, just like I said. Huey shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't   gonna make it, are we Chuckie?   I ain't never gonna see it. It's   over for that, isn't it Chuckie?   Just say it. Chuckie is taken aback by what Huey is saying. He walks a turns his concentration back to the flashlight. Huey call after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was just some stupid housewife mouthin' off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET REAL Huey! And shut the fuck up about the stupid ocean. Chuckie gets right up in Huey's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ever break a promise to you? I ever let you down? Huey takes his time to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Chuckie, you ain't. Chuckie puts his hand on Hueys shoulder and gently pushes along the road. 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della tries once more to lift the hood. It still won't bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she looks up the flashlight is dancing towards her. Vinh sees the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's her Ford. Della grabs the lug wrench and toolbox and ducks behind t trees. Della sees them approach her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's broken glass everywhere. Huey, now resigned to their mission, comments sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone call her mama tell her to lay out her black dress. Della creeps softly along the edge of the trees. She hold her breath. If she makes a sound, she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she dead already? The boys kick around the Explorer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musta gone been thrown through the windshield. Della skims the trees, constantly checking behind her, to where her antagonists check out the Ford wreck. Chuckie points to some footprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't dead. Look! Her footprints are all around. When there's enough distance between them and her, she da from the forest's edge into the development and hides beh a half finished house. 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans against a recently bricked wall, finally takes breath. The smell of fresh cement and putty fills her nostrils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain gathers and drips from a nearby ledge She peers around the side of the house. 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the rows of plots of land with their sold signs, s sees the boys still pacing and debating beside her Ford, illuminated by the sweeping light rays of their flashligh Her eyes drift across the landscape of house foundations structures to the distant neon lights of the shopping mal When she looks back over for the boys, she sees that the flashlight and the boys are gone. She strains her eyes. Guesses that must mean they're off looking for her in another direction. She clutches the tool box and silently creeps between the houses. If she could just track along the edge of the development could maybe make it back to the Shopping Mall, to the twi An owl hoots from the trees behind. She freezes, eyes sweeping the immediate area for danger. She waits a moment, silence, then makes her way once more between the edge of the development and the edge of the trees. She's trying desperately not to make a sound, praying to invisible, eyes darting around, evaluating every shape an form. On one side the dense wood of trees, predominantly pine, thick ancient trunks and tangled branches. On the other, plots and structures of homes to be. She keeps trudging on, skirting the edge of the trees, following the lights in the distance. She hears a loud thudding noise. Stops. Stops breathing. 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, piles of planks wrapped in black tarp block her vi She braces herself, peers cautiously around, sees nothing She clutches the lug wrench and toolbox and steps forward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain water from the branches of a nearby tree is dripping down and collecting in a puddle in the middle of the tarp causing the sound. She breathes a sigh of relief. 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaps of damp shingle and cement cause her to back up and around past them and a cement mixer. She loses sight of t neon mall lights. She panics. 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs between the foundations of two houses. She stops suddenly when she sees a giant shadow looming across her path. She ducks down the side of a half finished house. Sees that it is the shadow of an earth moving truck. She keeps going, between the houses, looking for a sign o the mall lights. She stops. Just ahead, a flurry of footprints. They're her footprints! 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds herself back where she started, at the same hou The mall lights flicker in the distance as far away as th always were. The Ford's still there ahead. And then she sees the flashlight sweeping towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) NO! OH NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bites back a sob. 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della shrinks backwards between the houses. She ducks int an unfinished doorway and watches the boys pass ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs into the house and out through the far side. Ski a row of plots of land. Then, she hears Chuckie's mocking voice, echoing through the building site.

dialogues.speaker: DELLA
dialogues.text: Della recoils. Did she just hallucinate? How the hell do they know her name? Can they see her? Or is he just shouting her name randoml into the night? Her eyes dart right then left then back again.   Nothing. She runs down a row of house foundations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della! 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della dives into an unfinished house, hides behind a spac where a window will eventually be, looks out across the building site. All is dark outside. And then she sees the light several rows down, weaving between the houses. She makes for another window at the opposite end of the house. She sees the mall lights and decides to head once towards them. 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She creeps out of the house and crosses several rows of houses, then several more, heading towards the neon light the distance. 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops dead in her tracks. Straight ahead, a truly chilling sight - her kids stuff from the car : Terri's li anorak, Tammi's socks, mittens, strung along a short stre of wire fence. Her feet start to sink into wet mud. She covers her mouth stop herself crying out. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the development is illuminated by a huge construction light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della ducks down, tries to run. The mud cloys at her feet 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps up onto a plank that stretches between the firs floors of two houses. She starts to cross when she sees t silhouettes. 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're searching the house next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd little red riding hood git to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't leaving any bread crumbs that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a nigga hungry, Imma wolf. 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She backs up, slips, slides off the plank, falls into the mud, catches herself on some barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? The wire drives through her coat and into her right shoul She jerks away but the length of loose barbed wire follow She bites her lip to prevent a pained response. She's caught in its spiral like a trapped animal. She spi around and physically pulls the wire from her back, teari her coat. She casts the wire away from her. Winces. 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls into the foundations of a nearby house, undern the floorboards which are lain roughly across to form a f floor. She huddles in a dark corner. It's very quiet and cramped. She tries not to move, not to breathe. The smell the wet earth underneath makes her feel nauseous. A momen passes. It feels like an infinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to creep along towards a gap in the planks to if she can see anything above. Just as she approaches the she hears. The sound of footsteps above her. She freezes. The footsteps make erratic rhythms across the planks. She silently undoes the catch of the toolbox. Her hands a shaking. She lifts the lid. She rakes around inside for tools, comes across several kids toys instead! In shock, rakes around some more, trying to find something else, something more dangerous, anything. To her surprise the o tools inside are a pathetic little screwdriver and a smal crescent wrench. The kids must have borrowed the other to replacing them with the toys. She gives up, closes over t lid. Then suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole house is illuminated. She looks up to see four faces looking down at her. Chuckie points the gaze of a powerful flashlight directly into her eyes. The beam almost blinds her. She tries to look away but Chuckie focuses it right in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peek a boo! She shrinks back towards the wall. Her mouth feels dry, s dry. Tomas lifts several planks up and casts them away so they can see her. She's cornered. Chuckie then lowers the flashlights direction and sweeps voyeuristically down across her body. The light lingers on her breasts. Huey whistles appreciatively, picks the game back up from the parking l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo left without yo goodbye kiss. The light sweeps past Huey's hips. The sound of a zipper. light sweeps back up onto Della.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a window shopper little brother. You ain't never even done the old in and out before. Waves of pain spasm through Della's shoulder. The boys snigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imma just a young playa tryin' to put my bid in. Tomas leans down towards Della. Chuckie moves the flashli to illuminate them both. Tomas drains the last dregs from bottle of Bud, tosses the empty bottle down into the foundations. It rolls into the darkness. Della shudders. She clutches the lug wrench against her c behind the tool box and tries to disappear into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, when we done wit you we send yo back in yo trunk to Mr. Podunk. Tomas reaches down and pulls Della up to standing by the collar. He then yanks the coat down over her shoulder. Th white shirt she wears underneath is damp with sweat makin the form of her breasts very clear. Chuckie keeps the light focused right on her. Tomas slides his index finger down across Della's neck towards her breasts. Della claws at Tomas' face with the nails of her free han He staggers to the side holding his cheek and cursing. He chewed nails haven't left any dents, but she stunned him. The others laugh. She shrugs the coat back over her shoulders and pulls it tight across herself, once again clasping the toolbox clo to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want to play nice? Puta! He moves towards her, face twisted with hate, arm raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off five minutes, my Ghetto brother. Tomas glares at Della, then lowers his arm. Spits on the ground instead. Turns back to the boys. Chuckie moves forwards and focuses on Della's box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the man size crast? Della doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You running with the family jewels? Della still doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rob a bank this morning, Della? Della remains determinedly mute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least yo learned something tonight Della honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like how to quit mouthing if you wanna avoid drama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be wondering how we come to know your name. Chuckie giggles. Della shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You screwed up Della Myers. Left your purse in the Ford. Chuckie holds up her driving licence and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a shitty photo! Chuckie nods to Vinh. Vinh passes his lighter to Chuckie. Chuckie lights the licence on fire. The plastic burns bla and toxic. The flame annihilates Della's name, her date o birth, her face. Pieces of plastic unfurl and drift up through the empty windows and doors of the unfinished hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you won't be needing it no more. Della stares defiantly, fighting back the internal nausea caused by this symbolically brutal act. Chuckie maneuvers the light back in her eyes then right b on his own menacing face. Then, back again on her face. S becomes disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's in the box? Della remains mute, looks away from the beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo think she carrying the big notes, maybe some ice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it ain't about to rain diamonds, Huey. But maybe she cashed in her life savings. Planned to take off, start a new life. Della tries to swallow but her throat is too dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right Della?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got enough scratch in there to grease us up with? She knows there is nothing that would buy them off and th knowledge sinks like a stone deep into her gut. Chuckie follows her face with the beam. She tries to dodg its glare in her eyes. But he maneuvers it like a surveillance camera. His voice takes on a meanness that makes the back of her tingle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it. They crowd closer toward her. Dark forms with eyes glinting. Their voices echoing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the box else we put you in trauma.

dialogues.speaker: OPEN IT
dialogues.text: Della all but screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! I'll open it. Della's brain races. Her hands move slowly. She rests the lug wrench in her left palm under the base the tool box and with her right hand unsnaps the catch. She holds the far end of the lid up to shield her right h from the beam as she slips it inside the box. A prayer plays silently across her lips as her fingers fe the cool steel and shape of the small crescent wrench. She curls them around its handle and grips tight. A surge nervous energy courses through her veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't got nuthin'. Let's just take that pussy and git going. He moves towards her. In a flash, she withdraws the crescent wrench. She cocks wrist back and hurls the tool, snaps it just like her dad taught her to play baseball. The wrench flies up and across the house. With a CRUNCH, it catches Chuckie right in the collar bon right side. He screams. Drops the flashlight. Drops to his knees hold his throat. Della snaps the tool box shut and makes a run for it. She throws herself up onto the first floor and darts between Tomas and Huey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huey lunges for her but trips over a loose plank, lands w his face down, biting on the plank's edge. Della catches a peripheral glimpse of Tomas leaping towar her, but his leading foot slams down instead onto the bac Huey's neck. Grinds Huey's face into the plank with a hid THUD. Huey's neck SNAPS back smiley style. Huey's scream gurgles into the night. Huey's body falls through the spa in the floorboards landing with a thud in the foundations below. Tomas falls away, cursing in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maricon! Della makes a run for the doorway. She jumps down onto th muddy lot and heads off across the development. The darkn quickly swallows her. Behind her, Vinh slumps through the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck, niggaz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hurt?

dialogues.speaker: SHUT THE FUCK UP.
dialogues.text: Chuckie slides down to be beside Huey in the foundations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't be using the N word. You ain't representing. GOT IT. That right Huey? HUEY. Get up Huey. HUEY

dialogues.speaker: GET UP
dialogues.text: Tomas staggers up to standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus hijo de maria el virgene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Vinh moves towards Chuckie who is crouched over Huey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little brother. Tomas approaches. He pushes Chuckie gently out of the way so he can see. He stares down at Huey's bloody meshed face. Tomas stagge backwards and crosses himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamacita! Madre de Dios! Chuckie punches Tomas' leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tread on my boy's face. YOU KILLED HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill him. I didn't kill no one. Tomas pushes Chuckie backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did it. She killed him. Chuckie and Tomas stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna cross that bitch out. 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della runs for her life. She makes straight for the cover the trees. She hesitates for just a moment after the firs layer of Pines. It's pitch black beyond. Then she steps i She follows her breath into the icy blackness. Branches and foliage scratch against her face. She grapples about, looking for hiding places between the dark shapes and forms. Steps between tree roots and shrub Her eyes begin to adjust. She can now make out the difference between the clumps of darkness and tell, looki back, where the edge of the woods begins. A construction light shines behind like a distant moon. Scene 97Page 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes between the branches of indistinguishable tree some thick and knotted, others slight and brittle. Only t evergreens still have their foliage. Looking back constantly to the edge of the trees for a si of the boys. Fear drives her further into the woods towards where the trees grow even more densely together. Where there just m be the right place to hide. She stops for a second to catch her breath. The handle of the toolbox has chaffed her right palm. She changes hands. God, that boy Huey! He really died back there. She heard sound of it. The horrific sound of him dying a stupid pointless death. It could have been her. There has to be some way out of this nightmare. Ahead, a dead tree with spectral branches blocks her path She steps around its huge trunk and tangle of roots.

dialogues.speaker: DELLA
dialogues.text: Chuckie's voice drifts towards her.   She ducks down amon roots. Her eyes scan the darkness. No moving shapes nor forms. No sound. No flashlight. Just shadowy clumps of trees. Should she stay put or should she run? Then she sees it. The flashlight weaving through the pine ahead. She pushes further in among the roots, tries to make hers invisible. The flashlight beam sweeps across the forest floor toward her. One set of footsteps crunches through the foilage. She holds still, terrified. The flashlight pauses on the dead tree, the roots. Scene 97Page 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della stops breathing. Then, the light sweeps past and on into the woods. She waits until it disappears before stepping out of her hiding place. She creeps back in the opposite direction, figuring if they're in the woods now she should get out. Her eyes search for the construction light, which indicat the edge of the wood. She heads in the direction of the light, painfully aware one noisy footfall could alert her pursuers. She steps between leaves and roots as delicately as a ballet dancer The construction light grows closer. The light abruptly goes out. She stops, eyes desperately searching the trees. She resumes in the direction she was headed. Tries to kee calm. But the woods are impenetrable. Layers of trees and shrub and then more trees. Deep in the cold dark places there a patches of left over snow. She's losing her bearings. 98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, the chilling sight of four luminous Xs glowing in dark forest almost makes her heart stop. She realizes the crosses are painted on the trunks of several trees, marki them for death. She shivers. 99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She backs up, starts off in the opposite direction. And there it is again. The flashlight sweeping through th trees in the distance. She stops, close to screaming, then when the flashlight disappears, runs off in yet another direction. She slows to take a breath, notices the butts of several cigarettes still smoking in the dirt close to her feet. Scene 99Page 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to herself) Shit! Oh Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trudges on, pushing between the branches, no clue whe she is headed. The further she treads, the quieter it becomes. So quiet can hear her own footfalls and the sound of the trees breathing. Then, she spots the light again, in the distance, shining over the forest. Thank God! She trudges up a slope ahead, clinging onto branches and shrubs to help pull herself up. 100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light grows closer. She climbs up onto a ledge. A loud noise startles her. It's music. Rap music. Blastin Della pushes her way through to the edge of the trees. Sees.... 101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woodland ahead slopes down into a clearing, where a h ghetto blaster sits on a pile of felled trees. Young pine about to become Christmas trees. It's blasting out a hip anthem for a dead homie. A construction light illuminates clearing. A ghostly Vinh, head hung low, moves to the music, bottle beer in hand. Propped up against a tree stump sits the body of Huey, ar crossed over his torso, hood pulled up to cover his face. The scene is so surreal that Della is drawn closer. She creeps along the edge of the trees. As she moves, she kicks back on some dirt. It tumbles downhill into the gulch. She freezes. But nobody notices. She slips invisibly between the trees and watches as Toma enters the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomas stops and watches Vinh. Vinh continues to get into the music in his solemn Japane punk style. The juxtaposition between the hard core rap m and the serious vibe that Vinh is sending out shows us th this is really important music to him. It's a theatrical tableau - Della overhead, looking down on the clearing. Vinh transfixed by the music. Tomas stone silent, watching Vinh. It plays out for a poignant moment. Like they're all part some spiritual rite about to be consummated. Vinh pours some beer onto the ground at Huey's feet. A sm tear runs down his stoic face. Then CLICK. The blaster is abruptly turned off by Chuckie appears out of the shadows behind it. He stares a beat at Vinh like he can't believe what he's seeing. Vinh keeps on moving like he's in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doing? Vinh doesn't reply. Stares down at the ground, keeps on w his weird dance. Chuckie moves towards him. Tomas grabs Chuckie, tries to stop him from going for Vinh, but Chuck shrugs him off. Chuckie reaches out and shakes Vinh. No response. He shak him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you what your deal is, sand dancer? The second shake sort of breaks Vinh out of his trance. H shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tribute. A gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinh stares down at the dirt at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brain even smaller than 'em slits for eyes? Vinh slouches defiantly over to the blaster and presses t 8 replay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep on banging out that ghetto ass shit and you'll alert every cop in Podunk county.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for Huey. Our dead homie. The song starts again. Chuckie looks at him incredulously shouts above the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You checked out, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loved that track. Vinh snorts back a sob. He hugs himself into a hunch and starts dancing again. Chuckie loses it. He slaps Vinh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a grip, skippy. Vinh rubs his face. He's getting a grip all right. Chucki slams off the blaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huey's DEAD. And ain't no requiem gonna resurrect his ass. He down under the ground now with the real men of respect. The three boys stand somberly in silence, each paying internal homage to their dead friend. Chuckie hardens his heart against the tears that threaten to flow. Tomas trembles, mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it. I didn't do it. I didn't mean to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This breaks the moment. Chuckie snaps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he dead. That's it for him. OVER. But we still here. Hell, yeah. Payback's gonna be a real bitch for a real bitch. Vinh wipes away his tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She probably gone by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best hope not, genius. She gone, we gone. Chuckie paces around the circumference of the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della's been watching the scene unfold, a captive audienc attentive and terrified. Slowly she tears her eyes away from the boys. She backs a from the edge and right into the sharp branch of a big ol tree. The branch digs into that point in her shoulder she hurt earlier on the barbed wire. She reaches up to feel it and pulls her hand away bloody. reaches into her coat pockets for a tissue. Nothing. Feel something in her pants pocket. She pulls out not a tissue but a sheet of folded paper. She unfolds it. It's Tammi's drawing. The one from the beginning. dialogues.text: And that's hot, hell yeah. Frustration breaks through his voice. She can see his sha form moving through the darkness towards her. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're really cute. Chuckie clicks on the flashlight, shines it straight ahea right in between the plastic wrapped trees. Della freezes.   They? Chuckie's eyes penetrate the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twins huh?     Terri and Tammi. Della doesn't move. Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you could use that cigarette now Della honey? (he chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman's purse can tell her whole life story! Della stares petrified as he unfolds her purse from deep his jacket. He empties the contents out onto the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know where they are living, I'm thinking I may stop by after and say hello. Della wants to run at him so bad she almost hyperventilat But she also knows that's what he wants and she refuses t give him the satisfaction. We move in closer on Chuckie. He's looking right at where she's hiding, pure malevolence hardening his face to a ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't know a damn thing about what happened to Mommy while she was out, would they, Della?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move in on Della. Her knuckles are blue white and her are blazing. Rage explodes in her. She doesn't even reali that she is shouting till she's done.

dialogues.speaker: I'M GOING TO KILL YOU.
dialogues.text: Chuckie waltzes towards her hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured that would help you find your voice! Della crouches further in behind the felled trees. Why th hell did she shout? She could have been hiding anywhere. he must know for sure where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I would never touch them. It's wrong to hurt kids! Right, Della? She clamps her mouth closed. Chuckie continues waltzing toward her, stops about twelve feet away. He stares in between the felled trees like he has x-ray vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game's over. Chuckie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won! Sadness creeps into his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took him from me...He was only seventeen years old. And all he ever wanted to do was see the ocean. And he never saw it. No, he never got to go. Chuckie's grief sits like a stone in his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all gone now. Chuckie coughs, a dry laboured cough. He hocks long and deeply in his throat. But whatever it is he can't spit it out. He rubs his throat and collarbone gingerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the movie "Clockwork Orange"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della looks puzzled.   Yeah, and?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they were my droogies, Della.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chances are they would of turned on me anyway, just like in the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie paces around, deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of them was real ass outlaw. No, not in the way you are. You're the real deal, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was already thinking about cutting some of em loose, getting a new style posse together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della's head is spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's about it, you and me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be real. Has he lost his mind? She utters unde her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie reaches down, retrieves her diary from the dirt. cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monday night mechanics. Tuesday Pilates. Wednesday Spanish. Thursday, I wish....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face it, Della. You ain't no suburban housewife. Chuckie's eyes dart around in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you bought into the big lie, even tried to live it. Who could blame you? Husband, kids, security, every woman's dream, but not yours, Della. You know there ain't no such thing as security. He coughs some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm betting you didn't really know who you were until tonight. I reckon I know what you've been dreaming about though, what you've been aching for, through all these lonely, wasted years. Blasting out of Podunk without never looking back. Feeling the wind in your hair and the dirt of life between your fingers. Doing all the things they told you you ain't supposed to do. Taking what YOU want from life. And wasting anyone who stands in your way. Right, Della? She closes her eyes like she's seeing it all behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say you ain't thought about it. If it's in your blood, it's in your blood for all time. A longing sigh sneaks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had yourself fooled, Della. A single tear runs down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, lady, you took my whole crew out with nothing but a bunch of them tools. She opens her eyes. Scene 111Page 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go back to your old life. No way. It's all over for that. Kaboom. She doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooking up with me's about the best chance you got. He sounds deadly serious, seductive even. She's lost in s kind of trance, looking like she just might believe him. Can she possibly be believing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're on the outs with your old man. She inhales sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we pick up your kids, we can waste him if you like. She holds the breath in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do it. Or you can if you're ready. Della exhales, responds.       She seems lost to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want... But she doesn't finish the sentence. She rises slowly fro between the plastic wrapped trees. A momentary grimace of pain crosses her face. Then, their eyes meet, like for the first time. It catches them both surprise. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already did. He shines the flashlight on her path so that she can see where she is walking. Scene 111Page 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della steps around the plastic wrapped trees and between stumps. She heads towards him, slowly, deliberately. Chuckie's hands are by his sides. She stops a few feet aw from him. She can see him up close. The clearest view of him yet. T both look like they've been to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a night, huh? He lays the flashlight on the ground and turns the lens t point up through the trees and into the sky between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only going to the mall for some Christmas wrapping paper. Chuckie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit happens. They stare at one another, all alone in the night. A know moment stretches between them. She notices the gash of matted blood and bruising on his collarbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? Chuckie smiles, brings his teeth back into a scary, feral grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to look you in the eye before I kill you. Della doesn't react.    He brings up his hand, gun clutch pointed and ready. Della surprises him and us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I figured. She nods her head, points her chin over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huey there, going to help? Scene 111Page 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huey?   Huey's .... He glances to the side for a split second, turns the gun he turns his head. It's enough. Della slips the flare out her pocket and opens it in his face. Before he even has time to react she LEAPS at him with al the spring left in her legs. Her fingers close around the wrist with the gun. The flare falls aside casting its fiery glow across them. She crashes her good shoulder into the spongy place where collar bone is broken. It makes the ugly noise of sinew tearing.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIST
dialogues.text: She tumbles him down to the December ground and wraps her legs tight around him. Tight like a lover. She grinds her chin deep and forcefully into the area of broken collarbone, exacerbating the wound. He cries out, thrashes about. She keeps her body melded t his, grinding her chin even deeper. He wraps his arms tightly around her and pulls her even closer, wrenches her chin up and away from his collarbone They roll across the dirt.   He whispers, low and close t her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're even better than I thought. He pushes his mouth hard up against hers to stop her chin returning to the wound. She tries to pull away but he onl presses harder. Neither can break away. It's unclear who's got the gun. They roll until she suddenly pulls away, sits up. But he has her and she has him in a fatal leg lock. Scene 111Page 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she has the gun. They look at each other. He smiles. He makes for the gun. She fires into his chest, just once, it's enough. His legs release. He slumps back.   Blood darkens his shi Gun smoke coils from the dark bullet wound. Blood seeps below him from the exit wound, spreading out in a dark puddle. His body surrenders to death. She stares down at him. A queasy silent moment passes. Sh stares at the gun in her hands. It feels so heavy, so unr His dead eyes stare. She reaches over and closes them gen And she's light-headed, so light-headed she could just fl away. Somehow she stands up. She looks back down at the body, not quite believing he c be dead. She sees her silver locket lying beside him in t pool of blood. She retrieves it. Uses her sleeve to wipe the blood away its exterior. Inside the photos of her kids are still the tiny photos of Tammis little thoughtful face and Terri's mischievous one look back at her. She snaps the locket closed. She searches the area for the rest of her belongings, fin her wallet, her purse, her diary, her lighter, her tampax box, a lipstick in the dirt. She sticks everything in her purse. She almost misses her pack of cigarettes. We see t half buried under the dirt. She scans the area once more finds them. The pack is empty but she takes it anyway. It's time to go home. 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without really thinking about it, Della slips the gun int her pocket and starts running. Tree after tree disappears behind her until she sees the light ahead. That place where the rest of the world meets woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She peers through the last layer of trees like she would curtain to her other reality, the one she almost left beh The housing development is still there and not more than hundred feet away is her car. She hears the sound of distant sirens. 113

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries across the clearing towards her car. Sees the trunk is open. Sees sheets of wrapping paper blowing abou Sees the big red bow tangled around a pine. She quickly gathers them, stuffs them in her purse. A moment of trepidation as she reaches her car. What if i locked? What if the keys are gone? She presses the Ford's driver door handle and much to her relief, it opens. She sees the keys still dangling from t ignition. 114

dialogues.speaker: INT. EXPLORER- EVENING
dialogues.text: She climbs into the driver's seat and turns the key. No connection. No surprises there! 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back out of the car and looks nervously around nothing good could ever possibly happen to her again. The hood is still ajar by a few inches, the weight of pin branches still pressing upon it. She uses the last of her strength to try push them away. A few smaller branches gi way but the bigger one won't budge. She reaches under the hood for the bar and pulls hard. It scrapes along the inner surface of the hood as she forces to prop the hood open to its maximum, about fifteen inche The hood buckles but there's enough room for her to reach She fumbles about and finds the positive wire has come lo from its attachment to the battery. She re-attaches the w and, Presto, the car lights up and the keys start to ping She almost smiles as she forces the bar back down. The ho slams down after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly climbs back into the car and turns the keys. engine sputters but doesn't fully catch. She turns the ke again - another wimpy sputter. Again, this time the sputt gathers momentum, catches for a second, gives up. She tri again, the sputter gathers momentum and catches for real. Della looks over her shoulder and backs up, pulls out of tree, up and past the broken barrier and onto the road. S makes a tight U-Turn, sticks the car into four wheel driv and plows down the rough gravely road. 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes the Plymouth on her way. Sees its wheels lodge deep in the mud. Keeps going. 118

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives right on through the ghostly housing estate, slowing only to change back into drive as the road improv Empty houses flash past like a movie in rewind. The lights of the mall grow closer. 119

dialogues.speaker: INT. FORD EXPLORER- EVENING
dialogues.text: She passes that stop sign, sighs. The barrier is open and road up to the mall stretches freely ahead. She slowly in out on to the road and commits to her return to "civilization". 120

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road's empty. 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She punches the accelerator, drives just over the speed limit. 122

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concrete blocks of the mall rise from the wastelands ahead on her left. She slows, ahead there's a small traffic jam at the entra to the Mall road. Scene 123Page 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the siren before she sees the police car. God, she hopes they don't notice her smashed up windscree the fucked up side of the Ford. 124

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She edges slowly up to meet the line of cars. Watches as police car circumvents the traffic and pulls into the Mal road, to join a police car that already has the Mall entr road blocked off. 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.    How long has it been? That poor security gu She checks the car clock. It's only 85 minutes since she the house! Hard to believe. Feels like another lifetime. Another cop car whizzes past the line. How long before th come for her? She's got to get back to the kids. Della adjusts the rearview mirror. Her gaunt bloody face looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at her hands, they're ingrained with mud and bl And her clothes! While waiting for the traffic to start moving again she fumbles on the passenger seat, finds some kleenex. She wipes her hands, her face, using the rearview mirror, some Kleenex and the rest of the water. She looks only slightly better. The line starts moving. Della follows. She passes the pol cars, steals a cursory glance. She keeps checking her face in the mirror. The cars soon start to disperse in different directions. The Mall disappears behind her. She turns left onto an almost empt road. She can't wait to see her babies, make sure they're okay. could anyone expect her to go the speed limit at a time l this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits forty, forty-five, fifty. Takes it all the way u sixty. Runs a light. 126

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as the roads empty she's gonna own it. 127

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At sixty-five she races across the railway track. She slo down to just above speed limit when she sees a car ahead the adjoining road. With one hand guiding the wheel she grabs the lipstick fr her purse. She carefully applies it in the rearview but her mouth is parched it just cakes into her chapped lips. She wipes it away. 128

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives through the crossroads. 129

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She applies some lipstick to her cheeks to give her some color. But she just looks odd. She ends up wiping it away with the back of her hand. Gosh, this car in front is really taking its sweet time. decides to overtake. She accelerates to sixty. As she pas the driver stares at her car. She slows down so as not to arouse any more suspicion. Sh passes the familiar sign for "Pleasant Valley Drive". The road's empty ahead so she guns it to sixty-five. The closer she gets to home, the faster she wants to go. tries to resist but can't. The speedometer hits seventy. The car hurtles into the night. Oh No, a red light ahead. a car waiting to go in the opposite direction. She decide slow for this one. Barely makes it - screeches to a halt. driver in the forward facing car checks her out. She atte to smile and look like a normal housewife. 130

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits for the car to pass, then hits the accelerator again. She signals right, turns abruptly into meet the ga of Pleasant valley Dream Homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rakes about in her purse for her chub card, can't fin it. She presses the intercom. No one answers. She presses again. Still no answer. She backs out hard onto Pleasant Valley Drive. Luckily for her, the car she overtook a few minutes earlier pulls in. She tails the car tightly throu the gates which scrape shut against her back bumpers. But she's in. She guns it along Pleasant Valley Crescent and slows as s approaches the sign for Pleasant Valley Boulevard. Checks herself in the mirror. Pulls into the boulevard. When she sees her house ahead a huge sob engulfs her. She snorts it back. Not yet. Her face hurts so bad with repre emotion that it feels like it's made of stone. She pulls into the driveway. Smooths her coat. She glances at the gun, which lies on the passenger seat. She turns off the ignition. She looks back at the gun. She removes the car keys from ignition. She glances at the gun. She looks at the house; it all looks normal. She takes a deep breath. She moves to get out of the car. She leans over, grabs the gun and sticks it in her purse. finds her chub card inside. She sighs. 131

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She remembers her shoulder hurts when she climbs out of t car. That her arm hurts when she pushes the car door clos behind her. That her heart hurts when she sees the star o the tree still lying there in the snow. The whole side of the car is scratched to hell and the windshield is shattered. She makes her way down the path the front door. She kicks off her wrecked muddy boots on front step. Turns the adjoining key, on the car key chain the front door lock. Pushes open the door. 132

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been? Scene 132Page 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth's voice meets her as she steps into the house. Ni welcome. She doesn't respond. Closes the door behind her. Walks in the house. There he is ahead, leaning against the office door. Beer one hand, remote in the other. The TV blaring behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said.... He's about to begin shouting again when he notices something's not right about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della? He switches the TV volume down using the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della honey are you all right? She stares back at him coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't call me that. Don't ever call me that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She steps slowly towards him. Sees a violent adventure fl wrapping up behind him on TV. The end credits scroll down screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to get home to my babies. Kenneth cannot understand her garbled words. He sees the dried blood on her chin, matted mud on her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you? She just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there an accident? Scene 132Page 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps staring, looks at him with a cold odd expressio She needs to be held like a child but he doesn't even mov towards her. Just stands there like a jerk, unsure of wha to do, so he takes a swig of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? That swig of beer turns what was left of her love for him stone. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they okay? Without waiting for an answer. 133

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and races up the stairs. 134

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door softly. The night light casts a pale g out low across the carpet. There they are, all tucked up their quilts, breathing gently, little faces flushed with sleep. She sighs, closes her eyes with relief, softly closes the door behind her. 135

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks back downstairs. 136

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth is pacing about the kitchen, opening another beer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound asleep, huh? Kenneth, unsure what to do, tries to make a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. What'd you bring me from the mall? Della sighs, calmly pulls out the gun from her pocket, lo him right in the eye, points the barrel at his face. Scene 136Page 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrinks back, silent for once, blind panic playing acr his face. But not hers. She's cold, cold as the icy night. She pulls the trigger at point blank range. CLICK He recoils. But no bullet disengages from the barrel. Nothing. She kn there were no bullets left. But the click echoes throughout the silent house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.
